best.why: It flows like a living continuation: picks up the 'flood' from II without repeating I, deepens the diagnosis with fresh pressure metaphors ('Abundance is pressure', 'mined resource'), sharpens the definition of slop as a condition rather than a medium, and lands the smelting line with rhythmic inevitability. The voice is pure manifestoâ€”short, prophetic, unafraid of the reader.

worst.why: Near-verbatim lift from the end of I, including the full Gutenberg-to-AI history. It stalls the momentum dead and makes the manifesto eat its own tail.

must_survive_line: The slop is not the problem. The slop is the raw ore. The problem is that you have forgotten how to smelt.
